metadata.title: CVE-2021-46943 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: media:staging/intel-ipu3: Fix set_fmt error handling If there in an error duringa set_fmt, do not overwrite the previous sizes with the invalid config.Without this patch, v4l2-compliance ends up allocating 4GiB of RAM andcausing the following OOPs [ 38.662975] ipu3-imgu 0000:00:05.0: swiotlbbuffer is full (sz: 4096 bytes) [ 38.662980] DMA: Out of SW-IOMMU space for4096 bytes at device 0000:00:05.0 [ 38.663010] general protection fault:0000 [#1] PREEMPT SMP

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46943` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-77-generic - 5.4.0-77.86~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-77-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-77.86~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-77-lowlatency - 5.4.0-77.86~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-77-generic - 5.4.0-77.86~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-77-lowlatency - 5.4.0-77.86~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1051-aws - 5.4.0-1051.53~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1082-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1051-azure - 5.4.0-1051.53~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-gcp - 4.15.0-1071.81
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1046-gcp - 5.4.0-1046.49~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
